The zucchetto is a small, hemispherical, form-fitting ecclesiastical skullcap worn 
by clerics of various Catholic Churches, the Syriac Orthodox Church, and by the 
higher clergy in Anglicanism. The plural is zucchetti; it is also known by the 
names pilus, pilos, pileus, ... Its name derives from its resemblance to half a 
pumpkin.
